Welcome to Tehillim Chooser

Wondering what Tehillim to say for your particular situation?! Look no further! Choose from one of the topics below and start praying to God, through these Tehillim, for your specific situation!

Choose a Topic to Pray

  • Used by Yeshua and the Apostles
  • Praise and Thanksgiving
  • Guidance and Success
  • Livelihood
  • Repentance
  • Pray for the Sick
  • To Have Childre

  • To Find One's Spouse
  • Help In Troublesome Times
  • Protection While Traveling
  • Protection of Israel
  • Danger to the Jewish People
  • Hallel
  • Songs of Ascent
  • Rebuild the Beit HaMikdash and Yeshua's Second Coming
  • Tikkun Klali of Rebbe Nachman
  • At a Person's Grave
  • Upon Giving Birth
  • On Rosh Chodesh

Tehillim 2

Why do nations assemble, and peoples plot vain things; kings of the earth take their stand, and regents intrigue together against the LORD and against His anointed? “Let us break the cords of their yoke, shake off their ropes from us!” He who is enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord mocks at them. Then He speaks to them in anger, terrifying them in His rage, “But I have installed My king on Zion, My holy mountain!” Let me tell of the decree: the LORD said to me, “You are My son, I have fathered you this day. Ask it of Me, and I will make the nations your domain; your estate, the limits of the earth. You can smash them with an iron mace, shatter them like potter’s ware.” So now, O kings, be prudent; accept discipline, you rulers of the earth! Serve the LORD in awe; tremble with fright, pay homage in good faith, lest He be angered, and your way be doomed in the mere flash of His anger. Happy are all who take refuge in Him.

Tehillim 12

Why do nations assemble, and peoples plot vain things; kings of the earth take their stand, and regents intrigue together against the LORD and against His anointed? “Let us break the cords of their yoke, shake off their ropes from us!” He who is enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord mocks at them. Then He speaks to them in anger, terrifying them in His rage, “But I have installed My king on Zion, My holy mountain!” Let me tell of the decree: the LORD said to me, “You are My son, I have fathered you this day. Ask it of Me, and I will make the nations your domain; your estate, the limits of the earth. You can smash them with an iron mace, shatter them like potter’s ware.” So now, O kings, be prudent; accept discipline, you rulers of the earth! Serve the LORD in awe; tremble with fright, pay homage in good faith, lest He be angered, and your way be doomed in the mere flash of His anger. Happy are all who take refuge in Him.
